com.hotmail.kalebmarc

Class Random

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hotmail.kalebmarc.jtools.Random

  • public class Random
extends java.lang.Object
    Class containing flexible and efficient methods to obtain pseudorandom integers.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int rInt(int max)
      Returns a pseudorandom anywhere from 1, to max.
      static int rInt(int min, int max)
      Returns a pseudorandom integer from min to max.
      static int rIntEven(int min, int max)
      Returns a pseudorandom integer from min to max, and will only return even values.
      static int rIntOdd(int min, int max)
      Returns a pseudorandom integer from min to max, and will only return odd values.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • rInt

        public static int rInt(int max)
        Returns a pseudorandom anywhere from 1, to max.
        Parameters:
        max - The max value to return.
        Returns:
        a pseudorandom integer from 1 to max.

      • rInt

        public static int rInt(int min,
                       int max)
        Returns a pseudorandom integer from min to max. More useful/flexible than returning a value between 1 and max (You can do that using this method anyways by doing rInt(1, max);). Negative numbers are accepted while using this method. If the max value is < the min value, it will be assumed you wanted it the other way around.
        Parameters:
        min - Minimum value to be returned.
        max - Maximum value to be returned.
        Returns:
        a pseudorandom integer from min to max.

      • rIntEven

        public static int rIntEven(int min,
                           int max)
        Returns a pseudorandom integer from min to max, and will only return even values. Ex. 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, etc. Will never return an odd value (1, 3, 5, 7, 9, Etc). If the max value is < the min value, it will be assumed you wanted it the other way around.
        Parameters:
        min -
        max -
        Returns:
        an even pseudorandom integer from min to max

      • rIntOdd

        public static int rIntOdd(int min,
                          int max)
        Returns a pseudorandom integer from min to max, and will only return odd values. Ex. 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, etc. Will never return an odd value (2, 4, 6, 8, 10, Etc). If the max value is < the min value, it will be assumed you wanted it the other way around.
        Parameters:
        min -
        max -
        Returns:
        an odd pseudorandom integer from min to max
